718559f-a.title: Manhattan: Centre Street - Chambers Street
718559f-a.text:
Centre Street, (running from left to right between frame shack and the partially constructed Hall of Records) between Chambers (left) and Reade (right) Streets, as seen from City Hall Place (foreground) and showing a small triangular plot (No. 158 on Plate 2 of G.W. Bromleys Atlas of New York City, 1897) occupied by a frame work shed of the subway construction Co. This piece of ground is today (1937) incorporated in the site of the Municipal Building; forming the horthwestern corner of same. The view is westward and shows on Chambers Street (left) a low structure at the S.W. corner of Centre Street that was occupied by Fire Engine No. 7 and Hook and Ladder No. 1 Companies. This also has disappeared. The slightly larger edifice, that still stands today, is the old City Court. Over top the roof of the latter appears the peaked ornamentation of the Home Life Insurance Co. Building. Note the
Emigrant Savings Bank sign.
718559f-a.folder: Centre Street & Chambers Street, Manhattan, NY

718600f-a.title: Manhattan: Chambers Street - Centre Street
718600f-a.text:
8-14 Chambers Street, adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of Centre
Street. No. 12 is the old Mechanics Hall.
About 1907.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

718601f-a.title: Manhattan: Chambers Street - Centre Street
718601f-a.text:
11-15 Chambers Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Centre Street. This site is now occupied by the Mhuicipal Euildingg. Aaron Burr had a law office in No. 13. Note the Hall of Records in the
background.
About May 1907.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

718604f-a.title: Manhattan: Chambers Street - Centre Street
718604f-a.text:
Chambers Street (center of No. 1 and to the left of No. 2) west from Center Street, (foreground, not seen) towards the North (Pudson) River, to show at the latter point, the S.S. Normandie sailing southward on her way to the ocean. She appears between Western Union Bldg. (view No. 2) and the 270 Broadway Bldg. (View No. 1). To the left bottom in the latter is the roof of the old
County Court House in City Hall Park.
Photogtaphers vantage point is the Municipal Bldg.
Auget 21, 1935.
P. L. Sperr,
718604f-a.folder: Chambers Street & Centre Street, Manhattan, NY

718598f-a.text:
1-35 Chambers Street, at the N.W. corner of Centre Street, showing the Hall of Records Building. The photographer's vantage point is the north easterly corner of City Hall Park and he shows Centre Street and a portion

718598f-a.folder: Chambers Street & Centre Street, Manhattan, NY

718599f-c.title: Manhattan: Chambers Street - Centre Street
718599f-c.text:
The Hall of Records Building, 35 to 1 Chambers Street at the N.W. corner of Centre Street, as seen from Park Row. The building on this site was used in Revolutionary times as a prison for American officers and dignitaries; it later was used as the Hall of Records. It was replaced in 1911 by the present building, designed by John R. Thomas, at a cost of over f7,000,O00.
June 22, 1933.
19
P. L. Sperr.  V2. A225
(2)
The same, as seen from a pathway in City Hall Pcrk; at the
extreme right is the Municipal Building.
March 5, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
718599f-c.folder: Chambers Street & Centre Street, Manhattan, NY
